name: Turkish Mythology - Semrük Bürküt with Male Shaman
description:
Semrük Bürküt is depicted as a two-headed bird in Başkurt folklore in Turkish Mythology.
One of the heads is a human head and speaks in the language of human.
He is immortal because he drinks the Water of Vitality (Mengü).
He lived on Mount Kaf and used to catch dragons in the lakes and throw them on Mount Kaf. He is big and strong as he can carry a person, forty jugs of water and forty pieces of meat on his back. It also took the name Simurg, which means "Thirty Birds".

Illustration by Ozan Bilaloğlu - 2021
